metadata.Title: CVE-2016-4076 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
epan/dissectors/packet-ncp2222.inc in the NCP dissector in Wireshark 2.0.x before 2.0.3 does not properly initialize memory for search patterns, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a crafted packet.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4076` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
libwireshark11 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
libwiretap8 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
libwscodecs2 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
libwsutil9 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
tshark - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
wireshark - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
wireshark-common - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
wireshark-gtk - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
wireshark-qt - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1').
